result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Michael Depalma was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

filed by attorney Amanda Riek

Defendant Richard Michael Depalma in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Sentencing arguments.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 months in jail, with Huber work release.  May transfer to Fond du Lac County.  $443.00 costs.  Submit DNA sample.  Bond on hand will be applied towards costs.  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  Jail start on 11/04/16 @ 7:00 pm.  A hearing will be held for credit issue at a later date.  8:37/9:15
